itemList.name: Bangkit Building
itemList.description: Bangkit Building at Telkom University, also known as the Rectorate Building, functions as the administrative and management center of Telkom University.

itemList.name: Lingian Hotel
itemList.description: Lingian Building is a hotel owned by Telkom University that serves as both accommodation and a souvenir shopping place of Telkom University.

itemList.name: Postgraduate
itemList.description: The Postgraduate Building is a facility dedicated to postgraduate programs, namely Master's (S2) and Doctoral (S3) programs.

itemList.name: Old Faculty of Electrical Engineering
itemList.description: Barung Building is one of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering buildings with 3 floors.

itemList.name: Old Faculty of Electrical Engineering
itemList.description: Ararkula Building is one of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering buildings.

itemList.name: Old Faculty of Electrical Engineering
itemList.description: Deli Building is one of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering buildings.

itemList.name: Faculty of Industrial Engineering
itemList.description: The Faculty of Industrial Engineering (FRI) is one of the first faculties established at Telkom University. It has five study programs.

itemList.name: Manufacturing Lab
itemList.description: Mangudu Building, also known as the Manufacturing Process Laboratory Building, is a facility at Telkom University dedicated to Industrial Engineering.

itemList.name: Faculty of Informatics (PUTI)
itemList.description: A strategic unit under the Rector that serves as the backbone of campus information technology services.

itemList.name: Faculty of Informatics (PUTI)
itemList.description: A strategic unit under the Rector that serves as the backbone of campus information technology services.

itemList.name: Faculty of Informatics (PUTI)
itemList.description: A strategic unit under the Rector that serves as the backbone of campus information technology services.

itemList.name: Faculty of Economics and Business
itemList.description: The Faculty of Economics and Business is a faculty that focuses on the study of Economics and Business.

itemList.name: Oplib
itemList.description: Telkom University’s Open Library is located in Manterawu Building. This library provides comfortable reading spaces, book collections, and journal access.

itemList.name: Faculty of Communication and Social Sciences
itemList.description: The Faculty of Communication and Social Sciences focuses on the development of communication, public relations, and social studies adapted to the digital era.

itemList.name: Faculty of Communication and Social Sciences
itemList.description: The Faculty of Communication and Social Sciences focuses on the development of communication, public relations, and social studies adapted to the digital era.

itemList.name: Faculty of Creative Industry
itemList.description: The Faculty of Creative Industry is one of the faculties at Telkom University focusing on education in Fine Arts and Design.

itemList.name: Faculty of Applied Sciences
itemList.description: The Faculty of Applied Sciences focuses on vocational education to equip students with practical skills and readiness to contribute to the workforce.

itemList.name: General Lecture Building
itemList.description: The General Lecture Building is a shared lecture hall that also houses the language center.

itemList.name: General Lecture Building
itemList.description: The General Lecture Building is a shared lecture hall that also houses the language center.

itemList.name: General Lecture Building
itemList.description: The General Lecture Building (GKU), also known as “Tokong Nanas”, is a 10-story shared lecture hall.

itemList.name: TULT
itemList.description: TULT is an iconic building of Telkom University housing three faculties: Informatics, Electrical Engineering, and Industrial Engineering.

itemList.name: Syamsul Ulum Mosque
itemList.description: The largest mosque in Telkom University, serving as the center for worship, studies, and Islamic activities.

itemList.name: Business Center Building
itemList.description: The Business Center Building is one of the buildings at Telkom University serving as its business hub.

itemList.name: Student Center Building
itemList.description: The Student Center Building often becomes the central place for campus activities such as new student registration, social events, seminars, and student organization meetings.

itemList.name: Multipurpose Building
itemList.description: The Multipurpose Building of Telkom University is designed flexibly to host various events, ranging from seminars, workshops, exhibitions, to student activities.

itemList.name: Auditorium
itemList.description: The Auditorium is an ideal venue for seminars, conferences, and screenings of academic or cultural films.

itemList.name: Dormitory Building
itemList.description: The Telkom University Dormitory is a residence specifically for freshmen during their first year of study. It consists of 18 buildings, 10 for male and 8 for female students.

itemList.name: Bandung Techno Park Building
itemList.description: Bandung Techno Park is Telkom University’s innovation and research downstreaming center, serving as a bridge between campus, industry, government, and society.

itemList.name: Greenhouse
itemList.description: The Greenhouse serves as the management center for various types of plants.

itemList.name: Jogging Track
itemList.description: The Jogging Track is one of the sports facilities featuring running and walking paths at Telkom University.

itemList.name: Deer Pen
itemList.code: The Deer Pen of Telkom University is an area for breeding and maintaining deer within the campus environment.

itemList.name: Cowo Canteen
itemList.description: A canteen near the Male Dormitory of Telkom University, serving as one of the culinary options on campus.

itemList.name: Bamboo Canteen
itemList.description: The Bamboo Canteen is one of the iconic and eco-friendly culinary facilities at Telkom University, located near the Female Dormitory.

itemList.name: Management System
itemList.description: The Management System at Telkom University is an eco-friendly waste management center.

itemList.name: Bird Sanctuary
itemList.description: This sanctuary serves as a conservation place for various birds, including peacocks, swans, and pigeons.

itemList.name: Animal Sanctuary
itemList.description: Tel-U provides an animal breeding facility such as deer, chickens, turkeys, and sheep as an educational and conservation medium.

itemList.name: Telkom Medika
itemList.description: TelkoMedika is a health service center for the entire academic community of Telkom University.

itemList.name: Telyu Coffee
itemList.description: Tel-U Coffee is a campus café strategically located behind the General Lecture Building (GKU), offering a comfortable atmosphere with a modern and cozy design.

itemList.name: Sport Center
itemList.description: The Tel-U Sport Center is the main sports facility on campus, located between male and female dormitories, supporting an active lifestyle for the academic community.

itemList.name: FEB Building
itemList.description: Maratua Building (FEB-D) is a lecture and administration building of the Faculty of Economics and Business at Telkom University.

itemList.name: TUCH
itemList.description: TUCH is used for Telkom University student graduation ceremonies, and it also serves as a center for introducing new students to campus life.
